# Description

Open & Responsible Science increases transparency and trustworthiness of research and it enhances its quality, visibility, and engagement. I’m proud I can support the Erasmus University Rotterdam programme in my role as project leader with the goal of making ORS the standard for science. As senior programmamaker at [Studium Generale](https://www.eur.nl/en/campus/art-culture/studium-generale), I’m passionate about public engagement and disseminating science.

```{r radarPlot, eval = FALSE}

member_name <- "Willem Scholten"
special_skill <- NULL

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c(all_of(special_skill), "open access", "open source software", "reproducible analysis", "data sharing", "data management", "preregistration"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)
```
